result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew S Griffin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Each count concur. No obj to early term of probation at 2 yrs if recommended by agent, if he completes GED/High School Diploma & completes treatment.

miscConds.notes: $243 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MB.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015.
Obtain & maintain a residence approved by the agent. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.
$243 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.
$243 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.

Defn request Sig Bond, State opposed; Court reduced Cash Bond to $350 per case, Referred to BMP, random drops; BMP to set all conditions

CASH BOND SET - REFERRAL TO BMP
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $350 per case. If approved and accepted by BMP the defendant may post cash bail - at which time the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  Defendant shall submit to random UA's as a condition of BMP at minimum.  
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Michael B.

- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $500.00(per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
